intro: Patania obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved patania, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Patania obtusifolia is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
